summary: This document is Ghislaine Maxwell's application for a second U.S. passport, submitted in March 2003. It includes her application form, travel itinerary for a trip to Israel, Jordan, and Saudi Arabia, and a supporting letter from Jeffrey Epstein, who identifies himself as the managing member of LSJ, LLC, and describes Maxwell as an executive of the company requiring the passport for business travel.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.role: Passport Applicant, Executive of LSJ, LLC
persons.context: She is applying for a second U.S. passport, citing extensive business travel for LSJ, LLC, with a specific trip planned to Israel, Jordan, and Saudi Arabia.

persons.context: He writes a formal letter of support for Ghislaine Maxwell's application for a second passport, on behalf of the company LSJ, LLC.

connections.description: Epstein, as managing member of LSJ, LLC, writes a letter supporting Maxwell's passport application, identifying her as an executive of the company.
They are both associated with the company LSJ, LLC, with Epstein as managing member and Maxwell as an executive.

events.title: Planned Business Trip to Middle East
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell is scheduled to travel on LSJ business to Israel, Jordan, and Saudi Arabia.

events.title: Passport Application Submission
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell submits an application for a second U.S. passport, supported by a letter from Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell applied for a second U.S. passport in March 2003.
Jeffrey Epstein, as managing member of LSJ, LLC, wrote a formal letter of support for her application.
Maxwell's stated reason for needing a second passport was to avoid conflicting visa stamps during business travel to Israel, Jordan, and Saudi Arabia.
The application includes a detailed travel itinerary for a trip departing March 16, 2003, with flights on El Al, Royal Jordanian, and Saudi Arabian Airlines.
The supporting correspondence establishes a formal business relationship between Epstein and Maxwell through the entity LSJ, LLC.
